sn48.125-136:2.1: 13 Another Chapter of Abbreviated Texts on the Ganges, etc.
sn48.125-136:4.1: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn48.125-136:4.2: In the same way, a mendicant developing and cultivating the five faculties slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn48.125-136:4.4: It’s when a mendicant develops the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi,
sn48.125-136:4.5: and wisdom culminating in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn48.125-136:4.6: That’s how a mendicant developing and cultivating the five faculties slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
sn48.125-136:7.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn48.125-136:7.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn48.125-136:7.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
